channel.title: Homes on Julia Stewart Lowndes
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Julia Stewart Lowndes

item.description: About me Hi, I’m Julia, or Julie, or Jules. I am a Mozilla Fellow and marine data scientist at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS). As Science Program Lead for the Ocean Health Index (OHI), I work to bridge marine science, data science, open science, and management. I lead open data science trainings through NCEAS, Software Carpentry, RLadies, and Eco-Data-Science. I earned my PhD from Stanford University in 2012.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I teach the following courses in OHSU’s Computer Science and Electrical Engineering (CSEE) graduate education program: MATH530/630: Probability and Statistics for Scientists & Engineers CS627: Data Science Programming (with Professors Alexander Kain & Steven Bedrick) CS631: Principles and Practices of Data Visualization (with Professors Steven Bedrick & Jackie Wirz)
